msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the right hand side; almost regularly cut at the left. 3 kolleses at the middle of col. 147, the beginning of 148 and the end of col. 148. Both the top and the bottom of the column are broken. The papyrus has lacunae in several places. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Maron, son of Maron, grandson of Petsoraipis, mother Herois (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 186)
Ptolemaios, son of Naaraus, grandson of Horion, mother Taorsenouphis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
Chairemon, son of Horos, grandson of Onnophris, mother Segathis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 247)
Horos, the son, mother Stotoetis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 249)
Ptolemaios, the other son (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)
Petheus, son of Nestosiris, grandson of Petheus, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 202)
Petesouchos, son of Petesouchos, grandson of Petesouchos, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Petheus, son of Kollouthos, grandson of Phaesis, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 202)
Sarapion, son of Perigenes, grandson of Akousilaos, mother Tanais (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)
Leonides, son of Petheus, grandson of Artemidoros, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 184)
Dionysius, bastard, mother Tepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 162)
Phaesis, son of Sisois, grandson of Phaesis, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 246)
Phaesis, son of Heras, grandson of Orsenouphis, mother Isidora (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 246)
Sisois, son of Limnaios, grandson of Satabous, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 229)
Apynchis, son of Pnepheros, grandson of Pakysis, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 154)
Sambas, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Sambas, mother Taeuhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 224)
Anchophis, son of Petheus, grandson of Anchophis, mother Aphrodous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 149)
Aphrodisios, the son, mother Melanous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 157)
Melanas, son of Pnepheros, grandson of Pakysis, mother Tasoucharion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 188)
Petsiris, son of Petesouchos, grandson of Petheus, mother Apia (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 211)
Aphrodisios, son of Ptolemaios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 158)
Ptolemaios, son of Naaraus, the elder, grandson of Theabennis, mother Tamarres (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 217)
Ptolemaios, son of Esouris, grandson of Heras, mother Thaesis
(see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)
Charidemos, son of Petoraipis, grandson of Onnophris, mother Thaesis
(see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)
Kastor, the younger, son of Achillas, grandson of Kastor, mother Aphrodous
(see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Athenion, son of Horos, grandson of Pakysis, mother Heras
(see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 150)
Petheus, son of Didymos, grandson of Maron, mother Tauris
(see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 201)
Kopaneus, son of Polyndion, grandson of Kopaneus, mother Politta
(see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 184)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
